sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action retrieves build status, build timestamp, and complete build information of a given job from Jenkins Server.

Inputs:

  • Job Path - Name of the Job to retrieve build information from. Provide full path if your job is under a folder. E.g. UAT-jobs/Jpetstore_v1.0.
  • Build Number - Build number of a job to retrieve build information. E.g. 5.

Outputs:

  • Build Status - Will be set to the build status retrieved from a given job. E.g. "SUCCESS", "FAILURE", "ABORTED", "UNSTABLE" or "RUNNING".
  • Build Timestamp - Will be set to the build timestamp retrieved from a given job. The retrieved timestamp is the start time of the build. E.g. Fri, 09 Mar 2018 06:10:10 AM.
  • Build Information - Will be set to the build information retrieved from a given job.
  • Job Type - Class of the job.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Either Build Number or Job Path doesn't exist or not accessible.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Get Build Information

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action retrieves build status, build timestamp, and complete build information of a given job from Jenkins Server.

Inputs:

  • Job Path - Name of the Job to retrieve build information from. Provide full path if your job is under a folder. E.g. UAT-jobs/Jpetstore_v1.0.
  • Build Number - Build number of a job to retrieve build information. E.g. 5.

Outputs:

  • Build Status - Will be set to the build status retrieved from a given job. E.g. "SUCCESS", "FAILURE", "ABORTED", "UNSTABLE" or "RUNNING".
  • Build Timestamp - Will be set to the build timestamp retrieved from a given job. The retrieved timestamp is the start time of the build. E.g. Fri, 09 Mar 2018 06:10:10 AM.
  • Build Information - Will be set to the build information retrieved from a given job.
  • Job Type - Class of the job.
  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Either Build Number or Job Path doesn't exist or not accessible.
  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
